intro: Doronicum incanum, commonly known as the hoary toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological gardens.
